{{Wireless embedded system |brand=CC&C |model=WA-7200 |revision= |upc= |ean= |asin= |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=07/25/2013 |manuf_country=China |manuf= |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=wireless router |fcc_id=PANWA7200 |ic_id= |pwr_v=5 |pwr_amp=1 |pwr_conn=USB Male-A |pwr_barrel_inner= |pwr_barrel_outer= |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_vac= |pwr_ac_hz= |pwr_pol= |pwr_poe= |cpu1_brand=Realtek |cpu1_model=RTL8196EU |cpu1_cspeed= |cpu2_brand= |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |fla1= |fla1_brand= |fla1_model= |fla1_num= |fla2= |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |fla2_num= |ram1=32 |ram1_brand=Winbond |ram1_model=W9825G6JH-6 |ram1_num= |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |ram2_num= |expansion_if_types= |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module= |wi1_module_if= |wi1_chip1_brand=Realtek |wi1_chip1_model=RTL8188ER |wi1_chip2_brand= |wi1_chip2_model= |wi1_chip3_brand= |wi1_chip3_model= |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn= |wi1_txchains=1 |wi1_rxchains=1 |wi1_sstreams=1 |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if= |wi2_chip1_brand= |wi2_chip1_model= |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols= |wi2_ant_conn= |wi2_txchains= |wi2_rxchains= |wi2_sstreams= |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand= |eth_chip2_model= |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports= |wan_ports=1 |flags=USB charging port, portable |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=bgn |default_ssid=TravelXXX |default_ssid_regex=^Travel[A-F0-9]{4}$ |default_ip=192.168.1.254 |default_user= |default_pass= |oui=00:02:72 |oui_eth=00:02:72 }} '''WLAN 11n Router''' - ''11n Travel AP/Router''
"CC&C" and "WA-7215-V2" is silkscreened on the SoC board (SoC side) in the FCC photos. :"10G032800-0P", "DATE:", and "CC&C" appears to be silkscreened on the opposite side of the SoC board.
The default IP is per the FCC manual. :The default SSID pattern format appears to be '''TravelXXX''', where '''XXX''' is the last three hex digits of the LAN MAC. ::The default SSID format (and OUI) is per the EUT's label in the FCC external photos.
